Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Frederick A Ziesmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: AMENDED: Remaining Court Appointed Attorney fees in the amount of $5,210.50 to be collected by the Department of Corrections.

No contact with the victim.
No contact with any minor children, to include his daughter.
No consumption or possession of alcohol.
No entry into any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.

Comply with sex offender registry.
Undergo sex offender assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Comply with any conditions/programming per agent.
Undergo mental health assessment and follow through with recommendations.
No use or possession of weapons.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
(Case called at 9:02 AM)
Defendant Frederick A Ziesmer appears in custody with Attorney Matthew Krische.  Meri C. Larson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-Sentence Investigation reviewed by parties- no corrections.  State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  State presents sentence recommendation of 10 years initial confinement and 15 years extended supervision with various conditions.  Parties agree to 643 days sentence credit- so ordered by Court.  Defense presents sentence recommendation of 10 years probation, with 1 year conditional jail time, but if Court imposes prison, requests 3-4 years of initial confinement and 10 years extended supervision.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court orders 9 years initial confinement and 11 years extended supervision.  Conditions of extended supervision listed, to include no contact with any minor children (including his daughter).
Dated 5/21/18 filed by Attorney Matthew Krische to Court. 2 Character letters on behalf of defendant.
Dated 5/23/18 filed by Attorney Matthew Krische to Court. Character letter on behalf of defendant.
Dated 5/17/18 filed by Attorney Matthew Krische to Court. Character letter on behalf of defendant.

8: 30 AM.  Defendant Frederick A Ziesmer in court with Attorney Matthew Krische.  Meri C. Larson  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Time for pre-trial motions.  Motion in limine filed by Attorney Krische .  State has removed parts of interview that are not appropriate.  Exhibit # 1 is marked by State, transcript of interview with parts removed.  Attorney Krische has no objections .  State has no objection to the rest of defenses' motions in limine.  Court grants request for motion in limine.  Court will list all the witnesses.  Individual voir-dier will be done in Branch 4.   1 alternate -- 21 jurors.  Questions regarding sexual assaults discussed.   Preliminary jury instructions have been received. Jury will not be allowed to ask questions.  Other wording changed, removed.  Mention of mother not believing daughter will not be brought in by defense.   Priors will not be addressed.
